What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: An overview of Egyptian religious texts from the Old Kingdom to the Roman Period; we identified overarching themes and the evolution of the Pyramid Texts into the Coffin Texts into the Book of the Dead, as well as new developments whose origins we critically examined.

Architecture of different tombs and how they relate to the afterlife concept of Ancient Egypt Different Underworld Books and their locations in the tombs Presentation of a concept for practice for conferences Research regarding artifacts Research of concepts of the Afterlife

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved this course! I enjoyed its structure and how it was made clear from the very beginning. Sometimes it was hard to keep up notetaking with the pace of the course, but only because I was really fascinated and wanted to get every single word down. I like how we got an excellent overview of texts throughout Ancient Egyptian history, while still involving enough detail that we could really engage with the texts and compare them, both with each other and with architecture and material culture. The assignments (such as the mini-essay for grad students) were especially effective for this.
It's great and introduces all concepts of the Afterlife, along with the chronology and development of the afterlife

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Wonderful to understand ancientEgyptian afterlife and development of concepts
